sense.name: a source or cause of danger
sense.examples: High levels of mercury in the drinking water posed a health hazard to the community. That big pot hole in the road is a real hazard. Insurance companies are exposed to a moral hazard if the insured party is not honest. The patient is considered to be a hazard to herself. John doesn't understand the financial hazards of selling stock short.

sense.name: an unforeseen event, a chance occurrence
sense.commentary: HAZARD[+event][+unforeseen] Note: a rare, and sometimes literary, usage
sense.examples: We met, by hazard, in the old book shop on 4th Avenue. (by chance) It was only by hazard that he became king of the realm.

sense.name: designed obstacle on a golf course
sense.examples: Bob often loses a golf ball to the water hazard at the 13th hole. This golf course has a number of difficult hazards, both sand and water.
